q: Michael Arrington , who wrote that his blog was about to break the story about Eric Schmidt being tired and wanting out last summer. An interview with the three Google leaders convinced him to hold off, Michael Arrington wrote. Google insisted the story wasn't accurate, wasn't even close to accurate, and generally contained no accuracy whatsoever, Michael Arrington wrote.`` We killed the story, since their denials seemed fairly straightforward and honest, and we found no other independent sources.'' Thirty-five of the 49 companies in the S&P 500 that reported earnings since Jan. 10 have topped analyst estimates, with General Electric Morgan Stanley and Bank of America Corp. due to release results today. Recent data suggested the economic performance in Europe has been okay, and probably somewhat better than people expected, said Adrian Eric Schmidt , a currency strategist at Lloyd TSB Bank Plc in London. The euro strengthened 0.5 percent against the dollar, and was 0.3 percent stronger versus the yen. The dollar weakened 0.2 percent

But Steve Ballmer hinted that there are even more new features to come to the Windows Phone software. This year we're investing a significant amount to continue popularizing the phone, Steve Ballmer said. The company plans to add even more features along with next generation phones later this year, he said. He mentioned Samsung, LG, Dell and Nokia as companies bringing those new models

, made his second, headline-grabbing appearance at Britain's inquiry into the Iraq war. Some speculate that the Tony Blair appearance was exactly why Andy Coulson announced his resignation. Speaking Friday, David Cameron said: I am very sorry that Andy Coulson has decided to resign as my director of communications although I understand that the continuing pressures on him and his family mean that he feels compelled to do so.`` Andy Coulson has told me that the focus on him was impeding his ability to do his job and was starting to prove a distraction for the government, David Cameron said. its current workers are located. In a speech Tuesday, Eric Schmidt said Google Inc. will hire more than 1,000 workers in Europe this year. All told, Google Inc. has more than 60 offices in 30 countries. At this stage, the number of opportunities just vastly exceed the number of people we have at the company, said Alan Eustace , Google Inc. 's senior vice president of engineering and research.
